neighbors.name: Rick Jacobs
neighbors.claims: Rick Jacobs resides at 290 Biddy Rd SE with his wife, Tammy Jacobs ([source](https://georgia.ourstates.org/tammy-jacobs)). He is a local minister, frequently referred to as Rev. Rick Jacobs, who officiates services at area churches including Fellowship Baptist and Pleasant Valley South Baptist ([source](https://www.hendersonandsons.com/obituaries/Timothy-James-Timmy-Obenlander?obId=32563721)). Public records indicate he has previously advertised tractor work, fencing services, and fertile eggs for sale in Floyd County ([source](https://dlg.usg.edu/record/dlg_ggpd_i-ga-ba400-b-pp1-bf2-b96-s3)). The draft incorrectly identified him as the owner of L. Jacobs Farm (Wagyu cattle), which is located in Upson County, GA and owned by a different Rick Jacobs ([source](https://www.homes.com/property/0-mulberry-rd-molena-ga-unit-7513226/d0l19psyjstqb/)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Local pastor; officiates community funerals; small-scale agriculture

approach_recommendations.engage: Connect via shared community values, acknowledging his service as a pastor. Emphasize respect for property rights and the project's low impact on the quiet, rural character of the neighborhood.

neighbors.verification_notes: Corrected identity: Subject is a local pastor and resident, not the Wagyu farmer (different Rick Jacobs in Upson County). Confirmed wife is Tammy. No solar stance found.
